description: a(n) = smallest number m such that m and m+1 are the product of exactly n distinct primes.
comments: Prime factors may not be repeated in m and m+1. The difference between this sequence and A093548 is that in the latter, prime factors may be repeated. So the present sequence imposes more stringent conditions than A093548, hence a(n) >= A093548(n). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 21 2015A115186(n) <= A093548 (n) <= a(n). - _Zak Seidov_, Jan 16 20152^63 < a(12) <= 22593106657425552170. [From _Donovan Johnson_, Oct 23 2008]
example: 14 and 15 are both the product of 2 primes230 is the 3rd entry because we have (230=2*5*23, 231=3*7*11).
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jan 29 2000
